pr_title: KAFKA-10306: GlobalThread should fail on InvalidOffsetException

timeline.message: KAFKA-10306: GlobalThread should fail on InvalidOffsetException

timeline.bodyText: This is the actual bug: we swallow the exception. However, because we don't do any "seek", we just hit the same exception in poll() over and over and never recover but loop forever.
timeline.author: mjsax

timeline.bodyText:
We could also not wipe out the store and let the user do it manually. A manual cleanup is actually required nowadays, thus, it's actually a small side "improvement".
Note that we wipe out the whole global task dir here -- in contrast, users could do a manual per-store wipe out... But as we do the same coarse grained wipe out for all tasks and we have already a ticket for "per store cleanup" I though it would be ok for now.
Let me know what you think.
timeline.author: mjsax

replies.bodyText: Thanks @mjsax , this sounds perfect to me.
replies.author: vvcephei

timeline.bodyText: We just let the original exception bubble up, to be able to wipe out the store. -- This is also just a side "improvement"; we could also just die and let users cleanup the state directory manually. However, it seems better to wipe it out directly.
timeline.author: mjsax

timeline.bodyText: This test was broken: it throw the InvalidOffsetException only once and thus the second poll() succeeds -- however, this is not how a real consumer behalves.
